videoData.title: The future of economic success is collaborative
videoData.socialTitle: The future of economic success is collaborative

nodes.whoTheyAre: Jay Cousins is an inventor and entrepreneur who has sold millions of products. He is a catalyst for cultural change, helping to establish makerspaces and events in Germany and Egypt. He creates opportunities for businesses, hackers, artists and geeks to understand each other and collaborate. His latest projects include the Betabook.

videoData.description: These days, even big corporations are joining the open-source movement (ie. Tesla Motors sharing their patents with anyone interested in adapting and advancing the technology). How does this sharing concept compare with our current competition-trumps-all economic model? Jay Cousins explains that success today is often based on investing in not only the corporation but the rest of the industry's ecosystem. Urging us to "think like a mushroom, not like a dinosaur," Cousins explains why company longevity doesn't come from acting alone.
